definitions: causing problems, difficulty, or annoyance in a persistent way
examples: The troublesome leak kept returning despite multiple repairs
Dealing with troublesome customers requires patience and skill

definitions: causing anxiety, worry, or concern about something potentially negative
examples: The troubling news about climate change kept her awake
There were troubling signs of economic decline appearing

definitions: staying away from school or work without permission or valid excuse
examples: The truant students were found at the shopping mall
His truant behavior led to meetings with school counselors

definitions: in accordance with fact or reality; not false or erroneous
genuine, real, or actual; not artificial or counterfeit
steadfastly loyal or faithful to someone or something
examples: The true story was even stranger than fiction
Scientists seek true explanations for natural phenomena
This painting is a true masterpiece of Renaissance art
She showed her true feelings when she started crying
He remained a true friend through difficult times
The dog was true to its protective instincts

definitions: shortened by having the end or top cut off abruptly
examples: The truncate pyramid had its top section removed
The truncate version excluded several important chapters

definitions: shortened by cutting off a part, especially the end or top
examples: The truncated meeting ended after just thirty minutes
The article presented a truncated version of events

definitions: regarded as reliable, truthful, or dependable based on past experience
examples: She consulted her trusted advisor before making decisions
The trusted brand maintained quality for over fifty years

definitions: showing or tending to have faith in others' reliability and honesty
examples: Her trusting nature sometimes made her vulnerable to deception
The trusting child believed everything adults told him

definitions: able to be relied on as honest, truthful, or dependable in character
examples: The bank hired only trustworthy employees to handle money
She proved herself trustworthy by keeping all their secrets

definitions: reliable, dependable, and loyal, especially through long service or testing
examples: His trusty compass had guided him through many adventures
The mechanic relied on her trusty set of tools

definitions: telling or expressing the truth; honest and not containing lies
examples: The witness gave a truthful account of the accident
Children should be encouraged to be truthful with parents

definitions: difficult to endure; testing one's patience or endurance severely
examples: It had been a trying day with endless technical problems
The trying circumstances tested everyone's ability to cope

definitions: relating to or characteristic of the Russian tsars or their autocratic government system
examples: The tsarist palace displayed incredible wealth and luxury
Many tsarist policies were overturned after the revolution

definitions: relating to a tube or tubes, especially the fallopian tubes in anatomy
examples: The doctor diagnosed a tubal blockage causing infertility
Tubal ligation is a permanent form of birth control

definitions: short and somewhat fat in a round, plump way
examples: The tubby puppy waddled across the yard after eating
His tubby figure made finding clothes difficult sometimes

definitions: relating to, affected by, or caused by tuberculosis or tubercles in the body
examples: The tubercular patient was isolated to prevent spreading infection
X-rays revealed tubercular lesions in the patient's lungs

definitions: having or producing tubers; characterized by thick, fleshy underground stems or roots
examples: Potatoes are tuberous vegetables that grow underground
The gardener planted several tuberous begonias in spring

definitions: having the form of a tube; long, hollow, and cylindrical in shape
examples: The tubular flowers attracted hummingbirds to the garden
Engineers designed a tubular steel frame for strength

definitions: folded, gathered, or pushed into a small space or hidden position
examples: His shirt remained neatly tucked into his trousers
The cottage was tucked away in a quiet valley

definitions: having tufts or clusters of threads, hair, grass, or feathers
examples: The tufted puffin has distinctive feathers on its head
She chose a tufted sofa for the living room

definitions: making a loud, confused noise; uproarious and uncontrolled
very loud or full of confusion, change, or uncertainty
examples: The tumultuous crowd cheered when their team scored
The stadium erupted in tumultuous applause
They lived through tumultuous times of war and revolution
His tumultuous emotions made rational thinking impossible

definitions: having a pleasing melody or tune; melodious and harmonious to hear
examples: The birds sang tuneful songs in the morning light
Her tuneful voice made even simple songs sound beautiful

definitions: cloudy, opaque, or thick with suspended matter; not clear or transparent
examples: The turbid river water was unsafe for drinking
Heavy rains made the usually clear lake turbid

definitions: characterized by violent or unsteady movement of air or water
characterized by conflict, disorder, or confusion; not stable or calm
examples: The turbulent seas made sailing extremely dangerous
Turbulent air currents shook the small airplane violently
The country experienced a turbulent period of political upheaval
Their turbulent relationship finally ended in separation

definitions: moved to face or go in a different direction
changed or transformed into a different state or condition
examples: The turned corner revealed a beautiful hidden garden
His turned head showed his profile to the camera
The milk had turned sour in the summer heat
Her turned ankle required immediate medical attention

definitions: relating to or providing instruction or guidance, especially in academic subjects
examples: The tutorial session helped students understand complex concepts
She created tutorial videos for the software program

definitions: excessively or affectedly quaint, pretty, or sentimental
examples: The twee decorations made the room feel overly precious
Critics found the movie's dialogue too twee and artificial

definitions: made of or resembling tweed fabric
characteristic of country gentlefolk who traditionally wear tweed
examples: He wore a tweedy jacket to the country club
The tweedy texture gave the coat a rustic appearance
Her tweedy manner suggested old money and private schools
The professor had a tweedy, academic appearance

definitions: constituting number twelve in a sequence; coming after the eleventh
examples: December is the twelfth month of the year
She finished in twelfth place in the marathon

definitions: equivalent to the product of three and four; one more than eleven
examples: The jury consisted of twelve members as required
She bought twelve eggs at the grocery store

definitions: constituting number twenty in a sequence; coming after the nineteenth
examples: The twentieth century brought tremendous technological change
Her birthday falls on the twentieth of March

definitions: equivalent to the product of two and ten; one more than nineteen
examples: The meeting lasted twenty minutes longer than scheduled
Twenty students enrolled in the advanced chemistry class

definitions: thin and angular like twigs; having many small branches
examples: The twiggy branches broke easily in the wind
Her twiggy arms showed she needed better nutrition

definitions: of, relating to, or resembling twilight; dim or shadowy
marking the end of a period; in decline
examples: The twilight sky displayed beautiful shades of purple
They walked through the twilight streets of the city
He spent his twilight years writing his memoirs
The twilight days of the empire were approaching

definitions: paired or matched with another similar thing; occurring in pairs
examples: The twinned cities shared cultural exchange programs
The twinned towers stood as architectural landmarks

definitions: forming or occurring in matched pairs; creating partnerships between similar entities
examples: The twinning arrangement benefited both schools greatly
Twinning crystals showed interesting geological formations

definitions: forced out of natural shape by turning or winding
having thoughts or behavior that are regarded as abnormal or unhealthy
examples: The twisted metal showed the force of the crash
She untangled the twisted rope with patience
His twisted sense of humor shocked some people
The movie featured a twisted plot with dark themes

definitions: following a winding course; turning repeatedly in different directions
examples: The twisting mountain road required careful driving
The dancer's twisting movements captivated the audience

definitions: having many twists and turns; winding in a complex way
examples: The twisty plot kept readers guessing until the end
Children love the twisty slide at the playground

definitions: equivalent to one plus one; being one more than one
examples: Two heads are better than one for solving problems
She ordered two coffees to go this morning

definitions: having two parts or elements; twice as great or as many
examples: The benefits of exercise are twofold: physical and mental
Sales showed a twofold increase over last year

definitions: relating to the style, arrangement, or appearance of printed text and typefaces
examples: The typographic design enhanced the book's readability
Several typographic errors appeared in the first edition

definitions: relating to typography or the arrangement and appearance of printed matter
examples: The editor corrected numerous typographical mistakes
Typographical choices can greatly affect reader engagement

definitions: exercising power in a cruel, unreasonable, or arbitrary way; despotic
examples: The tyrannical ruler suppressed all forms of dissent
His tyrannical behavior at work created a hostile environment

definitions: present, appearing, or found everywhere at the same time; omnipresent
examples: Smartphones have become ubiquitous in modern society
The ubiquitous security cameras monitored every corner

definitions: causing or characterized by ulcers; relating to the formation of ulcers
examples: The patient was diagnosed with ulcerative colitis
Ulcerative lesions required immediate medical treatment

definitions: existing beyond what is obvious or admitted; intentionally hidden
examples: She suspected he had ulterior motives for helping
His generosity concealed ulterior purposes

definitions: going beyond what is usual or ordinary; extreme in degree
examples: The ultra marathon tested runners' endurance limits
She adopted an ultra conservative approach to investing

definitions: of a brilliant deep blue color like the pigment made from lapis lazuli
examples: The artist mixed ultramarine paint for the ocean
Her ultramarine dress matched the Mediterranean waters

definitions: relating to sound waves with frequencies above the upper limit of human hearing
examples: The ultrasonic cleaner removed dirt from delicate jewelry
Bats navigate using ultrasonic echolocation signals
